raw.title: [BIP-795] Kill Stale Gauges Q1 2025
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
PR With Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1816

**Summary and Motivation**

Per [BIP-750 2025 Gauge Management](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-750-2025-gauge-management-proposal/6248) the Balancer Maxis are responsible for killing gauges on a quarterly basis due to them becoming stale I.e. not voted for. The definition of stale as defined in the framework is a pool under 100k for >60 days and a pool without veBAL votes for >60 days. Removing these gauges from the system decreases overhead for gauge checkpointing, gas costs for the operation, and improves UX on the frontend and snapshot for gauge votes via Aura due to shorter lists and less clutter.

**Updated Kill Criteria**
* The gauge is flagged as worth killing if it has not received veBAL votes for >60 days, and the median TVL has been under 100k USD equivalent for >60 days ( [tracked by a dune query](https://dune.com/queries/4805654)).
* Gauges can still be killed at any time due to externalities, the rules above are simply meant to keep the system lean and efficient.

**Technical Specification**

The gauge list is generated by the data report from Defilytica https://balancer.defilytica.tools/gauge-kill-list which was used for this gauge removal set.

The DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the `AuthorizerAdaptorEntrypoint` at `0xf5dECDB1f3d1ee384908Fbe16D2F0348AE43a9eA` and call `performAction` using `0xab8f0945` for the data(bytes) argument and the “Gauge Address” list for each pool below will be used for the target(address) argument.

Edit:
* kill list set
* updated kill criteria

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-750] 2025 Gauge Management Proposal
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
PR With Payloads
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1642

### Summary and Motivation:

As we enter Q1 of 2025 the veBAL gauge system is expected to see aninflux of new gauges due to Balancer v3’s launch. This proposal will act to disable a large sum of Balancer v2 gauges which have been inactive for several voting epochs, and hold insignificant TVL, less than 100k USD. If executed this will set a framework for the Balancer Maxis to review the inactivity of gauges meeting this specific criteria quarterly, and put forward a kill proposal. The benefit is reducing operational spend on the gauge checkpointing operations done every voting round.

The criteria is straightforward, but can later be adjusted and is subject to exceptions if a gauge is vouched for on the forum.

* The gauge is flagged as worth killing if it has not received veBAL votes for >60 days, and the TVL has been under 100k USD equivalent for >60 days.
* Gauges can still be killed at any time due to externalities, the rules above are simply meant to keep the system lean and efficient.

This proposal will also enable several new gauges for pools on Balancer v3. Lists of both will be outlined below in the attached payloads, and can be cross checked against this [spreadsheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/12yhvFmXKZMwuyb0dUrPB-2WMKiQnHw9L3puDNe6Svjo/edit?usp=sharing).

Balancer v3 has successfully onboarded 30M TVL with minimal incentivization and diversity of assets thus far. In order for continued bootstrapping and veBAL voters to allocate their votes on v3 pools this will make the interface much more streamlined for everyone involved. This will also simplify the Aura, Hidden Hand, and Paladin markets in terms of voting and partner interactions. Based on the tokenomic updates coming to Balancer v3 pools related to yield fees and recycling of revenue. The core pool cycle will go live at the earliest convenience of the Balancer Maxis, with the expectation for the automation to be fully functional by the last week of January. All of each v3 pools revenue up until that point will be utilized in the first active incentive round.

In the scope of this proposal the ACX/wstETH pool on Balancer v2 will have it’s gauge weight changed to 100%, as opposed to 2% as it has proven to earn more than enough fees to deserve this increase.

## Specifications:

#### Gauge Kills

Due to the sheer size of the gauge kill list, the table will be left out of the proposal but can be referenced via this google [sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/12yhvFmXKZMwuyb0dUrPB-2WMKiQnHw9L3puDNe6Svjo/edit?usp=sharing).

The DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the `AuthorizerAdaptorEntrypoint` at `0xf5dECDB1f3d1ee384908Fbe16D2F0348AE43a9eA` and call performAction using `0xab8f0945` for the data(bytes) argument and the “Root Gauge Address” list for each pool below will be used for the target(address) argument.

#### Increase of ACX/wstETH Gauge weight cap:

The Balancer DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0xae60dce27f51ce5815357b9f6b40f200557867f8222262a1646c005d09b7dfba`

This role corresponds to `setRelativeWeightCap(uint256)` on mainnet gauges and can be confirmed [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/de8c3a52cb62185469dbbc90589afa83e5490760/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L726) in the Balancer deployments repo.

account: `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f`

The Balancer DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the `AuthorizerAdaptorEntryPoint` at `0xf5dECDB1f3d1ee384908Fbe16D2F0348AE43a9eA` and call `performAction` with

target: `0xf7b0751fea697cf1a541a5f57d11058a8fb794ee` being the ACX/wstETH root gauge and data `0x10d3eb040000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000de0b6b3a7640000` to set the cap to 100%

The Balancer DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `revokeRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0xae60dce27f51ce5815357b9f6b40f200557867f8222262a1646c005d09b7dfba`

account: `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` to revoke the previously assigned role to change gauge weights.

### Gauge Adds for Balancer v3

|Network|Pair|Pool Address|Root Gauge Address|
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
|Ethereum|Lido wETH/wstETH|0xc4ce391d82d164c166df9c8336ddf84206b2f812|0x4b891340b51889f438a03dc0e8aaafb0bc89e7a6|
|Ethereum|Aave wETH/ETHx|0x4ab7ab316d43345009b2140e0580b072eec7df16|0x1f3a4c8115629c33a28bf2f97f22d31d256317f6|
|Ethereum|Aave wETH/osETH|0x57c23c58b1d8c3292c15becf07c62c5c52457a42|0x70a1c01902dab7a45dca1098ca76a8314dd8adba|
|Ethereum|Aave USDC/USDT|0x89bb794097234e5e930446c0cec0ea66b35d7570|0xeec405b834c90b59122bcc2357f27110b2adb4b7|
|Ethereum|Aave USDe/USDT|0xc1d48bb722a22cc6abf19facbe27470f08b3db8c|0x95d260ac86b58d458187c819f87aad2c7c4203ef|
|Ethereum|rsETH/hgETH|0x6649a010cbcf5742e7a13a657df358556b3e55cf|0xcbc0a61E99fE3adba90BEAD3738446952bCb8002|
|Ethereum|shezUSD/sDAI|0xac035537edf62beef0c7208181379f89def22119|0xf6A9bbB5D9733fa6F77120683636061bc26E7E85|
|Gnosis|Aave wstETH/GNO|0x272d6be442e30d7c87390edeb9b96f1e84cecd8d|0x40B04058fF35fD3164E6cc66C4E6398c1E5E68c8|
|Gnosis|Aave wETH/wstETH|0x6e6bb18449fcf15b79efa2cfa70acf7593088029|0xfD151734ffC9A4A55C50fed4b66c15B06Bbb390B|
|Gnosis|Aave GNO/sDAI|0xd1d7fa8871d84d0e77020fc28b7cd5718c446522|0x5C36197A631649441649028110fa503a3be00162|
|Gnosis|sDAI/BRLA|0xa91c3c043051e7e680b61d79b3a733d3e2c0fb5e|0x7632c11C49E6091504Bb0395c0C81C8BE48f4a8C|

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the `GaugeAdderv4` at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments based on the table above:

gauge(address): `Root Gauge Address`

gaugeType(string): `Network`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-404] Kill Unused Gauges Week 33
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/468


#### Summary

The purpose of this proposal is to kill five* gauges which are currently not being utilized due to dead ends with partnership initiatives. The five* pools are the TWAMM rETH/wstETH on Mainnet, OHM/LUSD on Mainnet, cbETH/wstETH on Mainnet*, DFX/WETH on Arbitrum, and ACID/WETH on Arbitrum. These gauges have been active for several weeks and have received little to no votes. Killing these gauges keep our UI and system cleaner overall.

#### Motivation

The TWAMM rETH/wstETH gauge is proposed to be killed at the request of the Cron Finance team. The other 4* gauges serve no purpose to veBAL holders or Balancer users based on utilization. Removing them is a house cleaning in terms of UX and safety. 

#### Specification: 

The DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the AuthorizerAdaptorEntrypoint at `0xf5dECDB1f3d1ee384908Fbe16D2F0348AE43a9eA` and call performAction using `0xab8f0945` for the `data(bytes)` argument and the “Root Gauge Address” list for each pool below will be used for the `target(address)` argument.

|Symbol|Pool Type|Network|Root Gauge Address|Pool Id|
|---|---|---|---|---|
|wstETH/rETH/L|TWAMM|1|0xB5bd58C733948e3d65d86BA9604e06e5dA276FD1|0x6910c4e32d425a834fb61e983c8083a84b0ebd01000200000000000000000532|
|wstETH/cbETH|ComposableStable|1|0x01A9502C11f411b494c62746D37e89d6f7078657| 0x9c6d47ff73e0f5e51be5fd53236e3f595c5793f200020000000000000000042c |
|50OHM-50LUSD|Weighted|1|0xd8191A3496a1520c2B5C81D04B26F8556Fc62d7b|0x18fdf15ff782e44c1f9b6c5846ff6b0f0004f6a2000200000000000000000560|
|B-50ACID-50WETH|Weighted|42161|0x6ba66967B0723718d616ad5F293c2AE6d7b0FCAE|0xce2da1d3e5b5e4e1913f9ff65ee029d38682d8b900020000000000000000044e|

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-722] Kill Stale Gyroscope ECLP Gauges
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
PR with Payload:
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1436

#### Summary & Motivation:

Several Gyroscope ECLP gauges can be considered stale due to the Gyroscope sunsetting the old rehypothecation pool versions and the DAI migration to USDS. The goal of this proposal is to kill the stale gauges to remove clutter from the veBAL voter page, Aura snapshot page, and overall is a good housekeeping practice. There is no value being added by having these active in the voting system. USDS gauges to replace these are not proposed at this time but likely can be in a future proposal.

USDe/GHO on Arbitrum (old non-rehype version):
- Pool: [0x2B783cD37774BB77d387D35683e8388937712f0a](https://balancer.fi/pools/arbitrum/v2/0x2b783cd37774bb77d387d35683e8388937712f0a00020000000000000000056b)

GHO/GYD on Arbitrum (old non-rehype version):

- Mainnet Root Gauge: [0x9434c3955920A1FeD5e28ebCCEF80dCd54DEA180](https://etherscan.io/address/0x9434c3955920A1FeD5e28ebCCEF80dCd54DEA180)

sDAI/waUSDCn on OP (Spark DAI migration):
- Pool: [0x876E0A21626c33BDaB879330505eccc6091Aa607](https://balancer.fi/pools/optimism/v2/0x876e0a21626c33bdab879330505eccc6091aa60700020000000000000000012e)
- Mainnet Root Gauge: [0x9dE7f79Ef7f28447E90051b60aBC5c2b1AdFE1cf](https://etherscan.io/address/0x9dE7f79Ef7f28447E90051b60aBC5c2b1AdFE1cf)

#### Technical Specification:

The DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the `AuthorizerAdaptorEntrypoint` at `0xf5dECDB1f3d1ee384908Fbe16D2F0348AE43a9eA` and call performAction using `0xab8f0945` for the data(bytes) argument and pass each Mainnet Root Gauge as the root gauge address.

Mainnet Root Gauges:

2. `0xc028EFDa059e040b42998c96FF7fe0b126FA87fA`

raw.title: [BIP-515] Kill Unused Gauges Week 50
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/698

# Summary

Currently, there are over 100 gauges active for voting. Many of them are currently not being utilized due to either not participating in the voting incentive market, or not generating enough fees although being potentially eligible for the core pool framework. These gauges have been active for weeks or months without any significant voting activity. Therefore, killing these gauges is important to keep our UI system clear and remove inactive veBAL participants.

# Motivation

Based on overall inactivity on the veBAL voting system, we identified 21 gauges to be killed. Removal of these gauges serves the purpose of cleaning up UX and removing stale entries from the voting list.

Following gauges are considered to be killed:

The DAO Multisig 0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f will interact with the AuthorizerAdaptorEntrypoint at 0xf5dECDB1f3d1ee384908Fbe16D2F0348AE43a9eA and call performAction using 0xab8f0945 for the data(bytes) argument and the “Root Gauge Address” list for each pool below will be used for the target(address) argument.

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: The proposal to kill stale gauges Q2 2025 aims to improve system efficiency by removing inactive gauges, with strong voting support and neutral forum sentiment.
key_arguments_for: Strong unanimous voting support with 5 voters all selecting 'Yes, let's do it'.
Historical similar proposals with 'Yes, let's do it' succeeded and showed positive market and TVL impacts.
Proposal reduces overhead, gas costs, and improves user experience by cleaning up stale gauges.
Timeline metrics show early and stable support indicating community alignment.
key_arguments_against: No explicit negative arguments found in forum discussion or voting data.
Neutral forum sentiment suggests lack of vocal opposition but not strong enthusiasm.

evidence.quote: Forum discussion posts show neutral sentiment with no opposition comments before proposal end.
Timeline analysis shows 100% lead ratio and stability for 'Yes, let's do it' option.
Similar past proposals to grant permissions had strong 'Yes' votes and positive market/TVL responses.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.simulation_reason: Recommendation based on timeline and voting patterns, not final tally.
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
• Unanimous early and stable voting support for 'Yes, let's do it' with high confidence.
• Forum sentiment is neutral, indicating no opposition but also no strong vocal support; recommendation aligns with this neutral stance.
• Similar past proposals with similar voting patterns led to positive outcomes and increased TVL, supporting this proposal's expected success.
• Market metrics show slight positive TVL impact and minor price decline which do not negate the benefits of reducing system overhead and improving efficiency.
